sentences.en: a titanic struggle between good and evil
sentences.cn: 善与恶之间的一场大搏斗

sentences.en: Even by modern standards, the 46, 000 ton Titanic was a colossal ship.
sentences.cn: 即使按照现代的标准看, 那46, 000吨的泰坦斯尼克号也是一艘巨轮.

sentences.en: I was at the movies. I went to see Titanic.
sentences.cn: 我在看电影, 我跑去看《铁达尼号》.

sentences.en: In 1912, the Titanic sank on her maiden voyage.
sentences.cn: 1912年，“泰坦尼克”号在处女航中失事沉没。

sentences.en: Some found the conclusion of the film Titanic very disappointing.
sentences.cn: 有些人觉得电影《泰坦尼克号》的结尾是令人失望的.

sentences.en: TEN : Remember, the Ark was built by amateurs; the Titanic by professionals.
sentences.cn: 记住, 方舟是叫一群外行人建造的, 而泰坦尼克号是专家的杰作.

sentences.en: The ` Titanic'went to the bottom, ie sank.
sentences.cn: ‘提坦 ’ 号客轮沉入海底了.

sentences.en: The great ship, Titanic, sailed for New York from Southampton on April 10 th, 1912.
sentences.cn: 巨轮泰坦尼克号于1912年4月10日从索斯安普顿启航驶往纽约.

sentences.en: The Titanic took a severe blow from an iceberg before It'sank.
sentences.cn: 泰坦尼克重重地撞上冰山后沉没了.

sentences.en: The Titanic turned just in time, narrowly missing the immense wall of ice which rose over 100 feet out of the water beside her.
sentences.cn: 泰坦尼克号及时地转了方向, 勉强避开了高耸在它旁边超过海面一百英尺的一块巨大的冰墙.

sentences.en: The two of them are locked in a titanic struggle for control of the company.
sentences.cn: 他们俩为争夺对公司的控制权打得不可开交.

sentences.en: They went to the movie theater, where they saw the movie Titanic.
sentences.cn: 他们去电影院看了电影《泰坦尼克》.

sentences.en: This was a tragedy, the Titanic collided with the tip.
sentences.cn: 惨绝人寰的悲剧发生了, 泰坦尼克号与冰山相撞.

sentences.en: Titanic is regarded as his Best film so far.
sentences.cn: 泰坦尼克号被认为是到目前为止他拍得最好的影片.

sentences.en: We have been making titanic effort to achieve our purpose.
sentences.cn: 我们一直在作极大的努力,以达到我们的目的.

trans.tran_cn: <化>钛的，四价钛的，十分巨大的，非常庞大的
trans.tran_en: of or containing titanium, esp in the tetravalent state
